intro: Matelea gilbertoana, commonly known as Gilbert's matelea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and somewhat branched.
